snippet: Goats spray-painted onto planters in Kingston, N.Y., were considered vandalism by officials, but inspired acts of solidarity, though it’s unclear what the images mean.
abstract: Red spray-painted silhouettes of goats, first appearing at a controversial redevelopment project in Kingston, NY, are now a favored form of graffiti art far beyond the Hudson River Valley, even as far away as Miami Beach; it is not entirely clear what the goats mean, if anything, but they are an object lesson in how fast images can spread in the digital world, quickly taking on varied interpretations.
lead_paragraph: Goats spray-painted onto planters in Kingston, N.Y., were considered vandalism by officials, but inspired acts of solidarity, though it’s unclear what the images mean.

headline.seo: How Red Graffiti Goats in a Hudson River Town Became a Symbol of Something
headline.main: How Graffiti Goats Became a Symbol of ... Something
headline.print_headline: How Graffiti Goats Became a Symbol of ... Something
